alert.note: Alert for Logan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 29 at 2:23PM EDT until June 29 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Louisville has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Logan County in south central Kentucky... * Until 430 PM CDT. * At 123 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is expected to begin shortly. The threat is particularly high in the central part of the county, including Russellville. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Russellville, Anderson, Auburn, Adairville, Lewisburg, Danby, Cooperstown, Epleys, Cave Springs, and Dennis. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
